title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)
jresdk 106
Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. This can be observed with the enclosed class. As a programmer, I need to add a parameter to the 'baz' call in 'bar' to make the program correct.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl + Space to bring up the code assist feature.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()' from the filtered list.

Observed Behavior:
The code assist feature eats too much code, replacing the entire line with 'x.x.foo()'.

Expected Behavior:
The code assist feature should only replace 'foo()' in the 'baz' call, leaving the rest of the line intact.
OB: The code assist feature eats too much code, replacing the entire line with 'x.x.foo()'.
EB: The code assist feature should only replace 'foo()' in the 'baz' call, leaving the rest of the line intact.
